member.name: T:Microsoft.Crm.UnifiedServiceDesk.Dynamics.Controls.WebBrowserComboBoxItem.DataReadyBDC_EventStatus
member.summary:
Each value defines the firing status of DataReady and BDC event. Needed to determine weather or not to fire DataReady event as follows:
- When navigation to CRM page starts, value changes to NoDataReady_NoBDC - When prefetch completes and value is NoDataReady_NoBDC, fire DataReady and value becomes DataReady_NoBDC - When CRM PageLoad completes, value changes to DataReady_BDC, meaning both events are fired : - if DataReady has already been fired(value is DataReady_NoBDC), dont fire DataReady - if DataReady has not been fired(value is NoDataReady_NoBDC), fire DataReady -When CRM PageLoad completes and noscan is true, value changes to BDC_NoDataReady, meaning only BDC is fired

member.name: M:Microsoft.Crm.UnifiedServiceDesk.Dynamics.Controls.WebBrowserComboBoxItem.CheckAndFireDataReadyFromDataOnload
member.summary: This method must be called only when dataCaptured was false and was set to true just before calling this method. This is to make the firing of DataReady event in sync with firing BDC. DataReady will only be fired once for every navigate and the event must be followed by a BDC event.

Hence We are creating new AutomationPeer deriving from TabControlAutomationPeer.But ControlType Panel is returned instead. member.name: M:Microsoft.Crm.UnifiedServiceDesk.Dynamics.PopupNotification.Show(Microsoft.Uii.Csr.RequestActionEventArgs)
member.summary: This function implements Show action call on Popup Notification control. The Show action takes the following parameters. 1. Form Name - Required, Name of the form record which contains the XAML to be parsed 2. Left - Optional, Default value - 0, Horizontal offset in percentage 3. Top - Optional, Default value - 0, Vertical offset in percentage 4. PlacementMode - Optional, Default value - Relative, Is the popup positioned relative to desktop screen (Absolute) or USD window (Relative) 5. Timeout - Optional, Default value - Infinity, Time in seconds after which popup disappears if not focused

member.name: M:Microsoft.Crm.UnifiedServiceDesk.Dynamics.USDPopup.USDPopup_PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs)
member.summary: The WPF popup control hosts popup content in a WIN32 window. It filters MOUSEACTIVATE message and prevents popup window from getting activated on mouse click. The non-active window does not get keyboard input when the applicaion is not in focus. This is by design for WPF popup. But it blocks our scenario when user is trying to provide keyboard input on popup when the focus is not on USD. As a workaround, we need to explicitly activate window before the click tries to set focus on popup content.
